column2: Small gatherings of Twilight disciples have congregated here in the area. Though disorganized, these disciples and their leaders pose a very serious threat to unbelievers in the area.
An outpost has centralized operations within a dedicated keep. Cultists manage the region's levies from this dark keep and proclaim the Old Gods from its parapits.

A stone hold now dominates this region ensuring the influence of twilight does not go unchallenged. Its construction is beginning to deviate from normal construction standards as the Old Gods' influence seeps into the minds of those who work the keep.
For all those in area of this fortress, the whispers of the Old Gods permeate the minds of each and every unforunate soul in the region.
The strength of the voices are increased tenfold and the will of the Old Gods goes unpreturbed in the region surrounding this bastion.

Truly a testament to the servants of Y'Shaarj's power, this gigantic black stone citadel dominates the zone ensuring that the inhabitants of this land know that, though Y'Shaarj is a deceased evil, his terror and corruption may never be forgotten. Those who follow the Old Gods worship their ever-chattering voices beneath the shadow of his unforgotten will, forever entombed in this ziggurat.

An encampment has been erected and the cultists that find their home within it are more militarized and warlike than the average twilight cultist. Some even dare to call themselves zealots of the Old Gods.
The zealots here have entrenched themselves, providing a larger levy to the local Twilight lord and a greater garrison for the local keep.
Barracks have been formalized and constructed here and the structure is dedicated to the training and housing of devout Twilight zealots.
Practically a twilight hold in its own right, this monolithic stronghold houses hundreds of zealots ready to die well more than once for their Old God overlords.
Troops that find themselves less devout than the classic zealot find themselves arranging for battle at these mustering grounds.
The mustering grounds here have been painted black and violet with warpaint to further unite and strengthen the resolve of the rather disparate auxiliaries.
A garrison structure has been constructed to better house and train the twilight auxiliaries in the region as well as further indoctrinate them to the cause of the Old Gods.

Some of the heavily trained light troops have begun calling themselves 'Black Zealots' in honor of the heavier zealots they fight alongside. Their devotion rings true, and their weapons strike truer yet.
A shrine to the Old Gods has been constructed giving a common space for worship in their name as well as a place for the newly converted twilight cultists to rally.
Larger accomodations have been made for the rallying and worship in the name of the Old Gods, as this structure weeps their whispers into the land.
Walls of stone and tempered glass create a stunning hall of devout worship bringing more souls in the fold of the Void Lords.

Uncountable hours of labor have gone into the construction of this smaller ziggurat. Though it pales in comparison to its other sister ziggurats, it makes itself much more accessible to lower ranking cultists and new converts.
Rickety wooden barricades and walls have been constructed to help protect the twilight cultists and structures in this region.
The wooden walls have been replaced with dark stone, further increasing this settlement's strength against infidel attack.
Stone walls begin to grow taller and thicker around this twilight stronghold and the stones within the wall begin to echo with Their names.
The walls here have become infused with pure shadow magic, binding the stones together like a supernatural, unholy adhesive.

Shadows envelop this "unholy" place of insanity and whispering voices. Many twilight zealots and lower ranking cultists gather here to commune with the void and their Azerothian masters, the Old Gods.

The cultists here have become far more practiced in the arts of void magic, some of them even going as far as calling themselves "void callers". Darkness continues to seep into the land around this unholy sanctuary.
A grandoise cathedral of darkness dominates the surrounding area infecting the minds of those untouched by the Old Gods and their servants.

In a showcase of pure corruptive power, a huge ziggurat constructed of black stone dark as night has been erected in the name of C'Thun, the Old God prince of chaos and the Qiraj, his eldest servant race.
Several tentacles of composed of void-flesh amalgamations protect this fort from unwanted pests and skirmishes.
The fortifications here seem pseudo-sentient, but perhaps they are literally physical extensions of the Old Gods' will.
Brainwashed fodder protects this garrison, not through combat prowess, but through pure horde mentality.
The previous garrison has been augmented with devout zealots, further strengthening the horde that garrisons this fort.
